results.title: Mr Curry takes a bath
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
During winter, the Browns have a bath house and sauna built in their backyard. Mr Curry notices the new sauna and decides to try it for himself. This dismays Paddington and the Browns, since not even Mr Brown has had a chance to use it. Paddington offers to put his combination padlock on the door to keep Mr Curry out but mistakenly locks himself in. Paddington fumbles with the lock but Judy eventually manages to open it. Narrated by Michael Hordern.

results.title: Shelter construction in winter (Outdoor recreation)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Outdoor Education and Recreation”.
Whether camping out over night or just needing a place to rest from the wind and snow, comfortable shelters can be contructed easily, even during winter’s icy blasts. This location film shows the methods used to build a comfortable shelter.

results.title: Firemaking and shelters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Outdoor Education and Recreation”.
An experienced woodsman and a group are stranded in the wilderness. Led by the woodsman, they locate a good campsite, build a shelter of poles and evergreen boughs, construct a fire reflector and build a fire. The woodsman then demonstrates how a fire can be built even without matches, using the Indian bow and drill method.

results.title: Drown-proofing
results.creator_credit: Norman Keziere, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Outdoor Education and Recreation”.
Designed to help teach swimmers and non-swimmers alike how to survive a water accident, by showing how to stay afloat and travel in water, even if you have never learned to swim. The majority of men and women can remain on the surface in fresh water, and in salt water the human body is even more buoyant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Keziere, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions

results.title: The Chain of life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Vanishing Wilderness”.
Man is destroying his environment when he uses chemical instead of biological pesticide controls. Man is the end link in the chain of life and is limiting his own survival when he destroys other links in that chain.

results.title: Slow death of desert water
results.creator_credit: Shelly Grossman and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Vanishing Wilderness”.
Shows what is happening to Pyramid Lake, in Nevada, and its wild life because dams divert its source of water and sonic booms frighten its wild life. Based on the book “Our vanishing wilderness” by Mary Louise and Shelly Grossman and John Hamlet, 1969.

results.title: Santa Barbara: everybody's mistake
results.creator_credit: Shelly Grossman and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Vanishing Wilderness”.
Examines the controversies behind the 2 million gallon oil leak in the Santa Barbara Channel, off the coast of California in 1969. Shows how smog created by oil is killing pine trees high above sea level. The film asks why a society places such a high value on oil that it willingly endangers its own life. Based on the book “Our Vanishing Wilderness” by Mary Louise and Shelly Grossman and John Hamlet.
